clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Iocide Oral Rinse Against Gingival Inflammation
clinical_study.official_title: Phase II Study: Evaluate Efficacy of Iocide Oral Rinse in a Human Clinical Trial of Gingival Inflammation and Investigate Effects on Biological Markers Indicative of Systemic Disease

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to explore the efficacy of Iocide oral rinse in a human clinical trial of gingivitis. Iocide oral rinse will be evaluated against a placebo rinse. Indices for gingivitis, plaque and bleeding will be scored and blood tests will be performed to determine the effect of the antimicrobial oral rinse on relative levels of biological markers of inflammation.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Study Days -21 to -7 through Study Day 168

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study Day 1, Day 28, Day 84 and Day 168

other_outcome.description: The assessment of product safety will include the following: incidence of adverse events, measures of thyroid function, and iodine excretion. Additionally, investigators will assess any development of opportunistic infection with Candida albicans, changes in oral tissues, and concomitant medication interactions.

clinical_study.condition: Investigation of Biological Markers of Inflammation
